formattedAddress: 104 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 104 E 7th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
It is quite an expensive experience but is a worth one time experience.
Went for the croissant making class. It is a good detailed class in terms of learning about techniques. You make the croissants first with dough made from the previous class and then learn to make the dough. You get 2 doughs per table. So better to go in groups of 2-3 instead of a group of 4 which is max on a table. The dough making and lamination is taught later, the former part is mostly by the dough machine but the latter is again by technique.
You get to eat the made croissants and take them home.

originalText.text: I took a French croissant baking class here with Chef Jen--the course was excellent, we were provided materials and equipment. As well as step-by-step instruction for making traditional French butter croissants, ham and cheese filled croissants, and pan au chocolate. The chefs and staff provided everything we needed to condense the multi-day process into something we could accomplish in one evening, and we could eat/take home the fruits of our labor, which were delicious, of course. Teaching was fantastic, hands on, open to any and all questions, and very accessible to both new learners and experienced bakers. Highly recommended.

text.text: I took a French croissant baking class here with Chef Jen--the course was excellent, we were provided materials and equipment. As well as step-by-step instruction for making traditional French butter croissants, ham and cheese filled croissants, and pan au chocolate. The chefs and staff provided everything we needed to condense the multi-day process into something we could accomplish in one evening, and we could eat/take home the fruits of our labor, which were delicious, of course. Teaching was fantastic, hands on, open to any and all questions, and very accessible to both new learners and experienced bakers. Highly recommended.

originalText.text: We went to the croissant baking class, and we had a wonderful baking experience. In the first part of the class, we had already made dough that we rolled out and made into croissant shapes. However, this is because it takes about 3 days for French croissants to be made, and there‚Äôs no way we could start from beginning to end with our own dough. After we put the croissants in the oven, we did get to start  our own dough. Then the dough that we start gets put in the fridge, presumably to be prepared for the next class. The class instruction was also very well explained, and our instructor was very funny and engaging and helped us whenever we made a mistake. We got to take our croissants home and our instructor even gave us some of hers as well, and the croissants were so delicious they melted in my mouth. I would definitely recommend coming to another baking class here.

originalText.text: Took a croissant making class and had a lot of fun! Instructor Jen and assistant were super patient and funny. Looking forward to my next class!
